poem:
Alan Yentob: An Epitaph in Broadcast

In the glow of screens, he danced,  
weaving tales only dreamed in shadows,  
a figure both behind and before the lens,  
each frame a testament to endless curiosity.  
The oaken doors now close, but echoes remain,  
his vision a permanent broadcast,  
an unending signal across minds.
